Posts.Content: I’m thankful for options such as Ibrance. When we run out of options, life takes a drastic turn. So, I’m thankful that research continues and they keep coming out with new drugs. I’ve been on Ibrance/Exemestane for just about two months. My tumor markers went down the beginning of January (76.8) and now last week they are up again (114.1). The doctor is not too concerned but I’m worried that if it doesn’t change, we’ll have to go to something else. I hate using up “my cards”. I too have shortness of breath and extreme fatigue. But, I’ll take it as long as I can keep going. I just adjust my expectations. As far as the Ibrance commercials go, that’s the nice thing about a mute button, or just changing the channel. I ignore the ads.
Posts.Title: Commercials for Ibrance, etc.
